summary:
The Australian Open is a big tennis tournament held every year in Melbourne, Australia. It's the first of the four most important tennis events, known as Grand Slams. The tournament starts in mid-January and lasts for two weeks. Players compete in singles, doubles, and other events. Originally played on grass, it now uses a special hardcourt surface.

First started in 1905, it's now one of the biggest sports events in the Southern Hemisphere, with over a million people attending in 2024. It's nicknamed "the happy slam" and is known for its exciting, fast-paced games. The tournament brings in lots of money for the local economy, creating many jobs.
title: Australian Open
